intro: Dactylicapnos leiosperma, commonly known as the smooth-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of glossy, smooth leaves and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
